newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: FAILED MERGER CUT HEIDEMIJ '96 NET PROFIT.
newsitem.headline: FAILED MERGER CUT HEIDEMIJ '96 NET PROFIT.

text.p: Engineering consultancy Heidemij said on Tuesday 1996 net profits slipped due to an extraordinary charge resulting from the failed merger talks with sector peer DHV.
Income before extraordinaries picked up to 28.1 million guilders from a year-earlier 27.0 million.
"After an extraordinary charge of 2.0 million due to costs related to canceled merger discussions with DHV, (1996) net income was 26.1 million guilders," Heidemij said in a statement.
It said it would raise its dividend by 0.02 guilders to 0.55 per share.

Heidemij chairman Frans Luttmer said that Heidemij had achieved an increase in ordinary earnings growth despite higher financing charges, a lower contribution from non-consolidated companies and a higher tax bill.
Turnover had been boosted mainly by acquisitions, which bolstered the company's market position in the U.S. and Europe.
Last year, Heidemij acquired the remaining 30 percent of shares in Grabowsky&Poort, and opened new offices in Pakistan and Kazakhstan.
Organic revenue growth was braked by the difficult market for environmental services in Germany and the U.S.
